Reviews.Title: Perfect TV
Reviews.Author: Dustin Farahnak
Reviews.Content: This is a very nicely built television.Plenty of hookups, which were easy to reach.The Anyconnect (which allows one device to control another like Sony's Bravia, but for Samsung) works well.  It's nothing super, but it works.You can save favorite channels, easily and quickly switch to other inputs, play mp3s and jpgs via USB, ... ya know, all that stuff that you expect from a very nice TV.  It's not going to surprise you much.  The video didn't need any adjustment for me, out of the box, but there were a lot of options for tweaking it.Audio was average, not impressive, but I'm used to a nice surround system (which I promptly hooked up).  One reason Anyconnect is nice is that I can have the TV output over the surround sound (an Anyconnect system) very easily.Oh, and the dang stand swivels.  It's a heavy-ish stand, too.  Another commenter had a problem 'drilling' the stand, but I found this wasn't an issue.  I found the build quality to be the best I've ever seen on a TV.The picture, though, of course, is what matters most.  And this TV has an amazing picture.  Clear and beautiful.  The colors stand out, the contrast is strong, the blacks look black.The statistic that is weak on this TV is its slow refresh rate (the 60hz).  I actually prefer this TV over ones that have a higher refresh rate.  Movies look more like the cinema this way.  In fact, many movies are shown in theater at merely 24 hz.  Have you ever noticed that a movie or TV show looks subtly like a camcorder, behind the scenes tape, or a Soup Opera?  This effect is often the result of a high refresh rate, and it reduces the mental blur from frame to frame.  I suspect newer TVs actually let you reduce the refresh rate, because many find a high refresh to be less appealing.  But this way I get a cheaper TV that I think actually looks much better.  Before you spend hundreds more on a 2D set with extremely high refresh rate, test it out and see what you like better.  Make sure the media actually supports the high refresh rate.  You may find this cheaper set is as good, or perhaps better if you're like me.I found no flaws with this TV whatsoever.  It's amazing that such a large and beautiful TV, from what many consider the best brand, is so affordable.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV
Reviews.Author: Jedidad
Reviews.Content: Oh my, this is a beautiful TV. This TV is the first LCD HD TV I've ever bought. I've been watching a 10 yr old JVC CRT set that has served me well. However, it's only 30" and I wanted a larger screen.I was hesitant to buy an LCD TV since my old CRT is still putting out the sharpest picture around. But after getting the Samsung 46" and hooking it to my cable HD box I can say that I don't regret the purchase. I'm blown away at the quality of the picture.I also bought a Samsung Blu-Ray player and the quality of movies are unbelievable. I'm sorry I waited until now to go HD.I highly recommend this TV.One month update: I was a bit concerned with this TV being only 60Hz since I watch a lot of sports but I have not had any problems at all. Just recently watched almost every match of the World Cup and had no problems whatsoever with blurring or anything. NASCAR is beautiful on this set.I've got my old CRT set in my bedroom. It looks crappy now, LOL!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: 0ldman
Reviews.Content: Just an update... November 2013I've had the TV for three years now. Absolutely reliable, picture is still beautiful.I do wish it had a higher refresh rate and Auto Motion or whatever Samsung calls it, but I've found a work around with my computer, which is connected to the TV anyway.Bottom line, 3 years in, still happy with my purchase.-----I've had this TV for a month.I have a PS2, PS3, PC and DirecTV connected to it.The audio isn't great, but just slightly below average for a TV. The speakers facing downward make for a very clean look, but sound is just a bit spacey, but very clear. I have a home theater setup and didn't expect much out of the built in speakers. I was looking for a high quality 46 inch LCD monitor and that is what I got.As far as gaming lag, nonexistent.The picture quality is excellent. If you use Eco mode, brightness has to be adjusted up to make up the difference, otherwise the picture is just a bit too dark.With the backlight set to 8, the brightness set to 42 colors pop and blacks are black. It is a tad bright when watching at night with all the lights off, but Eco mode takes care of this. In Eco mode, brightness set to 10 is comparable to 8 without Eco mode.I did turn off the digital noise remover and edge enhancement, the MP4 noise filter is still enabled. With everything set default the picture was a little too smooth.We've watched HD movies and played a lot of games at 1920x1080, perfect performance and picture.I've recommended this TV to my friends. Thoroughly enjoyed this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Debs
Reviews.Content: The black Friday price point ($700.00) is what pulled me in. Great TV in this price range. The only issue I have with it is the motion strobe. This is my second HD LCD purchase. My first was a 40 inch Sony Bravia (also 60hz). My experience with that TV was the motion blur was barely noticeable, so when I bought the Samsung, I expected a similar experience. This is not the case. The blue is REALLY noticeable and can be quite distracting depending on the program or source. Blu-rays and DVD's don't give me the problem to the same degree as watching Direct TV. That said, at the end of the day, the screen size/image quality at this price point balances everything out and I'm satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: For $784 you can't do any better than this TV
Reviews.Author: A.J.
Reviews.Content: For $784 you can't do any better then this TV.  Free shipping, no interest financing and no tax.  Picture wise; in comparison to my previous Samsung TV (Plasma) for which I paid $1,200 3 years ago it's slightly better.  In comparison to other cheaper LCDs such as the Insignia from Best Buy this wins hands down. Blacks are actually black unlike on other cheaper LCDs where they appear to be gray.  The automatic "real time" brightness adjustment helps out too when the light changes.  I have this TV hooked up to my PS3 for Blu-Ray playback as well as gaming. Furthermore, I used the PC input to hook up my computer; I am extremely happy that, unlike my previous TV it maintains the 16:9 aspect ratio without stretching the screen (before I had to use DVI to HDMI to maintain the aspect ratio using up one of the HDMIs where now I can use the analog [VGA] and it works flawlessly).

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv
Reviews.Author: Revealed In Obscurity
Reviews.Content: Just got this tv yesterday from Fry's Electronics for 600 bucks. In store it looked amazing. Once I got home I immediately started watching an HD feed of a Lakers game which I had on my dvr box. I don't understand why people complain that 60 Hz is bad for sports when it looks just fine. Right now I'm watching the Pacquiao vs Mosley fight and it looks pretty good. Some HD feeds don't look that perfect and watching non HD feeds looks as if you're a watching youtube video, but that's not the tv's fault. My PS3 looks amazing on it. Movies on this thing, as opposed to other more expensive high end tv's, don't have that weird "soap opera" effect that looks as if they were filmed by amateurs with a camcorder.One thing I SHOULD note about this tv, is that it actually looks better when you're at an angle while watching it. I don't understand the science behind this, but nonetheless I'm pretty excited about this tv. Sure, LED tvs are leading the way now, but other that whiter whites and blacker blacks, I really don't see a difference in quality.HDTV's continue to evolve. 2 years ago this set probably would have cost 2 grand. I'm happy with the purchase and excited to see what the future brings with these tvs.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!...not so helpful manual
Reviews.Author: Gavin F
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Samsung so I figured the same after market wall mount could be used on my new TV..but no. The recommended wall mount screws do not work with the holes in the back of this TV. After being very frustrated that the maunal provided no help I came across the following infomation which I found helpful so I thought i would share.."After a $20 trip to the hardware store for a selection of M8 machine bolts invarious lengths I determined that you need to use 4 - M8 x 25mm machine bolts toattach a non-Samsung wall mount to this TV. Samsung provides 4 spacers to gobetween the back of the LCD and the mount. I used 1 lock washer, followed by 2flat washers against the mount with the Samsung supplied spacer between themount and the back of the LCD. "

Reviews.Title: Great Product and Phenominal Picture
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Wright
Reviews.Content: I have had several different HDTV's over the last few years.  LG, Vizio, and now a samsung.  I went to walmart to look at this TV in person and it outshined all of the other lcd's they had displayed there. This tv picture matches up with current led's when you are comparing contrast, and black levels.PRO's:Fantastic Picture: Great right out of the box and the colors are perfect. Blacks are also black and grey's are grey's.All of the ports you need, 3 hdmi, optical, pc, and other ports.Great Build Quality. Remote, tv stand, and the monitor are very nice.Best value.  You will not find a 46" tv with this nice of picture anywhere in this price range.Cons:Sound is just average:  If you buy a tv bigger then 42" you should be hooking this up to atleast a 5.1 surround system.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: John Kuzma
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this TV. The Amazon delivery folks came in and set it up without a hitch (there is no added cost for this service btw). The TV costs less than a third of the 50-inch plasma I purchased in 2006 (from Amazon naturally). Very happy with the picture quality and feature set. It does not have built-in Internet apps but since you can purchase a wireless Blu-Ray playerSony BDP-S570 3D Blu-ray Disc Playerfor less than $150 with Wireless-N connectivity and internet apps this was not a big deal. It does not have 120Hz refresh rate, but 60Hz seems to work just fine for my purposes. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture
Reviews.Author: William Sumrall "Bill"
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV locally one week ago when my Toshiba 72" back-projection HD went out. Been running it 14 hours per day to make sure it lasts either the 30 or 90 day (whichever)return policy.No problems and the picture is great! Matter of fact I can understand spoken words on it better than the other TV which had all kinds of speakers included.Have Cable (STD & HD) on one input and DirecTV input another. Have another HDMI input for Blu-Ray. HD picture programming is amazing!The base fit perfectly. No wobbles or shakes. Being able to adjust angle by +- 20 degrees is nice and used.So far, great for my use...

Reviews.Title: PERFECT!
Reviews.Author: AG
Reviews.Content: Ordered this on July 1st and had it in my hands yesterday (July 11th) so very quick shipping for a freight company! We plugged in in and watched a movie right away and its amazing! Works great and the standard settings it seemed to be shipped with work perfect, no problems what so ever. Very happy with this brand and TV!

Reviews.Title: Great item
Reviews.Author: Lucas Hoffmeyer
Reviews.Content: crystal clear reception and watch it every day it is now about 3 years old and still working away thanks

Reviews.Title: Wonderful picture
Reviews.Author: Katsumi
Reviews.Content: Arrived in a timely manner; the price at Amazon was the best of all.  TV did not quite line up with the stand so it could be connected. Took some effort and 2 people to coax it into place. Would highly recommend this set for picture quality and ease of tunning

Reviews.Title: TV Not Working
Reviews.Author: M. J. Schwab
Reviews.Content: WeBought this unit Sept. 9, 2010.  Wonderful picture - love it until last week.  Tried to power it on and nothing shows on screen except a very very light blue tint.  Everything frozen.  Comcast remote, TV remote do not work.  TV is definitely on - the little red light is off as when power is on - but the only way to power it off is to unplug it from the electrical wall box.  Comcast even came here to make sure it was not a problem with the cable box when I knew it was the TV and not Comcast.  I unplugged and replugged everything numerous times and it still was/is frozen.  We registered this set online and in doing so; Samsung offers a additional three month to the warranty.  So, thankfully, it it still under Samsung warranty.  However, the bad part is that Samsung apparently doesn't have enough factory authorized service people in our area. and the technician can't be here until Dec. 1, 2011 (if even then due to work load).....Another complaint is that the woman from Samsung could find nothing on her system indicating that I had registered this set online for the three month additional warranty.  I had to look at my paperwork and find the confirmation letter they sent us when I registered it.  She also could not see the email Samsung sent us reminding us that the extended warranty would expire on Dec. 11, 2011.Needless to say - we are not happy.  BTW - this unit is only used for no more than 4-5 hrs. a day. WE rated this as "it's ok" due to the fact that it failed us in a little over a year with limited use....

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality Parts
Reviews.Author: Serge Kavetsky "Mr. Fix-it"
Reviews.Content: I had the LN46C610 model for exactly one year. Started to flicker then eventually went dark. Common problem among the Samsung's of this series.  This same problem is described all over the internet. The repair tech that Samsung sent out wanted over $300 to replace the power supply.  Save yourself the headache and buy another brand. The Achilles heal of LCD series of this television was the power supply board.  It only lasted for one-two years before it would have to be replaced.  Replacement boards are now hard to find, because this was such a big problem.  Samsung chose to look the other way in the hopes that people would just buy a newer model after the one year warranty runs out. Hopefully the LED sets have a different power board.

Reviews.Title: Superb quality
Reviews.Author: J. Fiorello
Reviews.Content: I replaced my old 35" Sanyo CRT with this 46" Samsung Flat screen. Couldn't have made a better purchase. Picture quality is nothing short of spectacular. The sound quality is better than I've expected. I was planning on supplementing with Sony floor speakers.... but now undecided. TV is light for its size and was able to install and hook it up myself. Remote control is very easy to operate. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Droog
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this TV if you're looking for a sharp, clear, HD picture. My sister and I bought the same TV last fall, and neither one of us can tell when we're watching an HD channel or a non-HD channel. I've tried to get a refund on it, but I waited too long while I tried to troubleshoot with the cable company trying to see what the problem was. It was NOT our cable. Samsung won't do anything about it. I will never buy anything Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: Glad that I made this purchase!
Reviews.Author: Sharon Timmons "Sherry the Shopper"
Reviews.Content: Arrived quicker than expected. Assembly of tv base was relatively simple.Right out of the box it was great. Impressive to look at, I would definitely recommend.I am very pleased!!

Reviews.Title: Love Amazon and this is a great Samsung TV!
Reviews.Author: CDC
Reviews.Content: I just received my Samsung LN46C530 46-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTV today and have been watching a DVD on it and so far I am very pleased! The picture quality is very sharp, the TV is very user friendly, and I must give credit to the wonderful delivery of the TV also. (Advantage Relocation and delivery out of Panama City, FL was wonderful.) Amazon went out of their way to make sure I was satisfied and I really appreciate that. Thank you Amazon for making shopping with you a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46 in. LN46C530 LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Clyde Antrobus
Reviews.Content: Have been enjoying this TV for about 3 weeks now and it is top of the line. Great picture and the person who delivered it was top notch, and you can't beat the shipping. (FREE).

Reviews.Title: It's Ok... But I've seen better....
Reviews.Author: Sean Tolbert
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I really wanted to like the Samsung LN46C530. It was delivered on time and it was a breeeze to set up. However, it failed to produce better video quality out of the box then my old LG 720p LCD that me and my girlfriend had for over 8 years. We've probably had it longer than that. But back to the Samsung.... Settings were ok but it never gave me the impression that I was watching true HD. I'm not sure if it is due to my cable provider or if I needed to have it professionally calibrated but we were not impressed. I'm arranging to have it sent back in favor of an LG LED TV instead. At least that one I know I've seen in the local Best Buy and it looked absolutely gorgeous. This is our first Samsung product and I really wanted to dive into it considering it didn't break the bank like I've seen some of there newer models. In the end my girlfriend had the last say and opted to send it back.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy for the money
Reviews.Author: ken
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with vivid color quality. Smooth delivery & set up process. The internal sound system could be a little better but not an issue if you have a home theater sound system to hook it up to. All in all I'm very satisfied with purchase. The best part is no sales tax!

Reviews.Title: SEEMED LIKE AN OLDER MODEL!
Reviews.Author: sell
Reviews.Content: I ORDERED THIS SET FOR MY FATHER BECAUSE HE STILL HAS A VCR AND THERE WAS A PLUG IN FOR THOSE IN THIS SET. THE SET ARRIVED ON TIME AND IN PERFECT CONDITION. THERE WAS NO PROBLEM SETTING IT UP BUT WHEN IT WAS TURNED ON AFTER 5 MINUTES IT CUT OFF. IT CAME BACK WITHIN 1 MINUTE THEN TURNED OFF AGAIN. I HAD READ ABOUT THAT BEING A PROBLEM WITH SOME SAMSUNG TV'S. I CALLED THE HELP LINE AND EXPLAINED THE PROBLEM. THEY SAID THEY WOULD HAVE A REPAIRMAN COME IN 2 DAYS. THE TV CONTINUED TO WORK BUT KEPT CUTTING OFF AND ON. THE REPAIRMAN CAME AND REPLACED THE MOTHER BOARD. SINCE THEN, MY FATHER TELLS ME, ITS BEEN WORKING FINE. HE LOVES IT!!

Reviews.Title: Optimum picture settings for LN46C530?
Reviews.Author: Abe Vigoda
Reviews.Content: Can someone who owns this model please tell me the optimum picture settings for this TV such as Backlight, Contrast, Brightness and the like. I like this TV but I am terrible at calibration. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Stand Install Shows Very Poor Craftsmanship
Reviews.Author: John J. Malone
Reviews.Content: I haven't watched my new TV yet. The reason, in part, is that the installation of the stand is ridiculous. I suppose we just need to adjust to lousy machining these days, but when you have a 40lb plus piece of electronics being inserted into a plastic stand with metal screws AT THE VERY LEAST the screws and screw mounts should be well-machined.Samsung saved maybe 20 cents by machining the bottom of this set too cheaply. The crews simply WILL NOT drill int the mount. If you are going to have this TV sit in its stand, your are going to have a  dangerously wobbly TV set.Samsung's record profits are not going to last with the kind of machining that screams old school Korea.
